Package org.cvs.application.api

Class CandidateController

java.lang.Object
org.cvs.application.api.CandidateController
@Controller
@RequestMapping(path="/candidates")
public class CandidateController
extends java.lang.Object
REST service endpoint for candidate resources on /users.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yamiko J. Msosa

  • Constructor Details

    • CandidateController

      public CandidateController()

  • Method Details

    • addNewCandidate

      @PostMapping(path="") @ResponseBody public Candidate addNewCandidate​(@RequestBody Candidate candidate)
      Adds a new candidate to an optional portfolio via POST through URL: /candidates.

      Example payload: { "title": "Mr", "firstName" : "Test", "middleName" : "", "lastName" : "Candidate", "gender" : "F", "email" : "test@mail.com", "preferredContactNumber" : "08934514355", "alternativeContactNumber" : "", "addressLine1" : "56 Test Road", "addressLine2" : "London", "addressLine3" : "", "postcode" : "SE5 3SD", "country": "UK", "dateOfBirth": "1995-05-26", "portfolio":[{ "id": 136 }] }

      Parameters:
      candidate - the candidate (can be a JSON payload) to be added to the system.
      Returns:
      the newly added candidate

    • updatePortfolioWithCandidate

      @PostMapping(path="/{candidateId}/portfolios/{portfolioId}") @ResponseBody public Portfolio updatePortfolioWithCandidate​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long candidateId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId)
      Updates a new portfolio to an existing candidate via POST through URL: /candidates/{candidateId}/portfolios/{portfolioId}.

      Example URL: /candidates/1/portfolios/3

      Parameters:
      candidateId - the ID of the user to associate with the portfolio
      portfolioId - the ID of the portfolio to associate with the candidate
      Returns:
      the newly associated portfolio

    • getCandidate

      @GetMapping(path="/active/{candidateId}") @ResponseBody public Candidate getCandidate​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long candidateId)
      Fetches an active candidate via GET through URL: /candidates/active/{candidateId}.

      Example URL: /candidates/active/1

      Parameters:
      candidateId - the candidate ID as a request parameter to be used in the query
      Returns:
      an active candidate if found

    • deleteCandidate

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{candidateId}") @ResponseBody public java.lang.String deleteCandidate​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long candidateId)
      Deletes a candidate via DELETE method through base URL: /candidates/{candidate1}.

      Example payload: /candidates/1

      Parameters:
      candidateId - the ID of the candidate to be deleted from the system.
      Returns:
      a string that says 'Deleted'

    • retireCandidate

      @PostMapping(path="/retire/{candidateId}") @ResponseBody public java.lang.String retireCandidate​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long candidateId)
      Retires a candidate via POST through URL: /candidates/retire/{candidateId}.

      Example payload: /candidates/retire/1

      Parameters:
      candidateId - the ID of the candidate to be retired from the system.
      Returns:
      a string that says 'Retired'

    • getAllCandidates

      @GetMapping(path="") @ResponseBody public java.lang.Iterable<Candidate> getAllCandidates()
      Fetches all active candidates via GET through URL: /candidates/all.

    • getCandidates

      @GetMapping(path="/portfolio/{portfolioId}") @ResponseBody public java.lang.Iterable<Candidate> getCandidates​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long portfolioId)
      Fetches active candidates for a specific portfolio via GET through URL: /candidates/portfolios/{portfolioId}.
      Parameters:
      portfolioId - the ID of the portfolio to filter candidates for
      Returns:
      a list of all active candidates entries for a particular portfolio
